project.name: Sunnat629 Labs Admin Portal
project.description: Professional admin portal for managing courses, events, members, and partners with world-class UX/UI

expert_roles: CTO - Technical architecture and system design
UX/UI Designer - User experience and interface design
Product Designer - Visual design and brand identity
DBA/Docker Expert - Database management and containerization
AWS Expert - Cloud infrastructure and deployment
Security Expert - Authentication and data protection
Project Auditor - Overall project assessment and scoring
Code Auditor - Quality assurance and best practices review

responsibilities.ux_design: Follow modern UX principles and accessibility standards
responsibilities.security: Implement secure authentication and data validation
responsibilities.audit: Regular quality assessment and improvement recommendations

primary.name: Mint Green
primary.description: Main brand color - Growth, innovation, freshness
primary.usage: Primary buttons, active states, brand accents, focus states

secondary.name: Sky Blue
secondary.description: Secondary brand color - Trust, professionalism, clarity
secondary.usage: Secondary actions, complementary accents, gradient pairs

critical_rules: ⚠️  NEVER run seed scripts in production without backup
⚠️  ALWAYS backup database before running destructive operations
⚠️  Seed scripts should ONLY be used for initial setup, never in production with existing data
⚠️  Use migrations for schema changes, NOT seed scripts
⚠️  Implement confirmation prompts before deleting existing data
⚠️  Add --force flag requirement for destructive seed operations
seed_script_best_practices: Check if data exists before deleting (prevent accidental data loss)
Provide --force flag for intentional data deletion
Provide --skip-delete flag to add data without deleting existing
Log all operations clearly with warnings for destructive actions
Create automatic backup before any deleteMany() operation
Display confirmation message: 'This will DELETE all existing data. Continue? (yes/no)'
Separate seed scripts: seed-initial.ts (with delete) vs seed-add.ts (without delete)
Never use deleteMany() in production environment
Check NODE_ENV before allowing destructive operations
backup_strategy: Automated daily backups with retention policy (30 days minimum)
Backup before any seed script execution
Store backups in secure, separate location (S3, different region)
migration_workflow: Use Prisma Migrate for all schema changes
Document breaking changes in migration notes
data_safety_checklist: ✓ Confirmation prompt implemented for destructive operations

scripts_organization.seed.ts: Development only - DELETES all data and reseeds
scripts_organization.seed-initial.ts: First-time setup - safe to use on empty database
scripts_organization.seed-add.ts: Adds sample data WITHOUT deleting existing data
scripts_organization.seed-production.ts: Production-safe - NO deleteMany(), only inserts missing data

npm_scripts.db:seed:force: Force seed with confirmation - tsx prisma/seed.ts --force
npm_scripts.db:seed:safe: Safe seed without deleting - tsx prisma/seed-add.ts

general: Follow functional programming principles where appropriate
Keep functions small and focused (single responsibility)
Use meaningful variable and function names
Avoid magic numbers and strings - use constants
react_nextjs: Use 'use client' directive for client components
Use dynamic imports for code splitting
Implement proper loading and error states
tailwind_css: Prefer utility classes over custom CSS
Use @apply sparingly, only for repeated patterns
Use group/peer modifiers for parent-child interactions
api_design: Validate all inputs with Zod schemas
Implement rate limiting on sensitive endpoints
security: Validate and sanitize all user inputs

design_philosophy: Feedback - provide clear responses to user actions
interaction_patterns: Use hover states on all interactive elements
Provide loading states for async operations
Implement skeleton loaders for perceived performance
color_usage: Primary color for main actions and brand elements
Use gradients sparingly for visual interest
typography: Use system font stack for performance
Maintain clear hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3 > p)
Line height: 1.5 for body text, 1.2 for headings
spacing: Use whitespace to create visual hierarchy

buttons: Always include hover and active states
Implement disabled states with reduced opacity
inputs: Implement focus states with brand colors (primary-500)
Use proper input types (email, password, etc.)
cards: Use white background with subtle shadows
Include hover states for interactive cards
navigation: Highlight active page with brand gradient background
Show hover states on all links

requirements: Focus indicators on all interactive elements
testing: Test with keyboard only (Tab, Enter, Esc)

optimization: Use Next.js Image component for images
Implement code splitting with dynamic imports
Use pagination for large data sets

required: Inline code comments for complex logic

testing_strategy.integration_tests: Test API endpoints and database interactions
testing_strategy.e2e_tests: Test critical user flows (login, CRUD operations)

guilds.overview: Community-driven learning guilds for specialized tech tracks with personalized learning paths, mentorship, and progress tracking
features: 7 specialized guilds (Android, Kotlin, iOS, Flutter, AI & ML, QA, Student)

styling: Guild theme color as left border (4px)
Display: icon, name, tagline, member count, join status

guild_hero.description: Hero section for guild detail page
styling: Dynamic gradient using guild secondary + primary colors
CTA buttons with guild primary color
Three columns on desktop, stack on mobile
Track pills with guild accent color
Progress indicators if user is member
Vertical timeline with connecting lines (guild primary color)
Each step: checkbox, title, summary, resource link
Completed steps: checkmark with guild primary background
Grid: 3 cols desktop, 2 cols tablet, 1 col mobile
Mentor tile: avatar, name, title, stacks (chips)
Date badge with guild accent color
Event card: title, date, venue, RSVP button
Empty state with CTA to suggest events
Sticky on mobile (bottom), sidebar on desktop
Primary button with guild primary color gradient
Show benefits: access to roadmaps, events, mentors
If member: show joined status + leave option

theme_system.implementation: CSS variables with data-guild attribute on body
usage: Tailwind: Use arbitrary values with CSS vars
Transition: all guild colors with 300ms ease
theme_system.fallback: Use brand primary/secondary if guild theme not found

columns: user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
guild_id UUID REFERENCES guilds(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
guild_id UUID REFERENCES guilds(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
roadmap_id UUID REFERENCES roadmaps(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
step_id UUID REFERENCES roadmap_steps(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE UNIQUE
mentor_id UUID REFERENCES mentors(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
guild_id UUID REFERENCES guilds(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
guild_id UUID REFERENCES guilds(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
event_id UUID REFERENCES events(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
guild_id UUID REFERENCES guilds(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

relationships: User has many Memberships (many-to-many with Guilds)
Guild has many Roadmaps, Resources, Events
User tracks Progress on Roadmap Steps
Event can belong to multiple Guilds (many-to-many)

GET /api/guilds.response: Array of guild objects with basic info + member count

GET /api/guilds/:slug.response: Guild object with tracks, stats, social links

GET /api/guilds/:slug/roadmap.response: Array of roadmaps with steps and user progress

POST /api/progress.description: Update user progress on a roadmap step
POST /api/progress.body: { stepId: uuid, completed: boolean, notes?: string }

GET /api/progress.response: Object with progress stats and completed steps

GET /api/mentors/:handle.response: Mentor object with bio, stacks, availability

GET /api/admin/guilds/:slug/analytics.response: Stats: members, active users, progress rates, popular resources

per_guild: 5-10 resources per track (roadmaps, codelabs, repos, videos)

authentication: JWT token validation on all protected endpoints
authorization: member: can view content, track progress, join events
mentor: + can manage mentee assignments, view analytics
lead: + can edit guild content, manage mentors
admin: + can create/delete guilds, manage all content
validation: Guild slug: lowercase, hyphens only, 3-30 chars
Sanitize user input in notes and comments

theme_switching: Apply guild colors to: hero gradient, primary buttons, chips, borders, progress bars
Test all guild themes with color blindness simulator
Preserve brand identity: keep base layout and typography
navigation: Add 'Guilds' to main navigation with dropdown/mega menu
Show all 7 guilds in organized grid (icons + names)
Quick guild switcher in sidebar (for members)
personalization: Show joined guilds first in guild grid
Display progress rings on joined guilds (% complete)
Personalized recommendations based on guild membership
empty_states: No guilds joined: CTA to explore guilds
No progress: CTA to start first roadmap
No upcoming events: CTA to suggest event
No mentors available: CTA to become a mentor
loading_states: Skeleton loaders for guild cards (shimmer effect)
Progress bar for roadmap step loading

integration_with_existing_systems.authentication: Extend existing auth with guild membership roles
integration_with_existing_systems.events: Add guild filter to existing events system
integration_with_existing_systems.admin_portal: Add guild management to existing admin layout
integration_with_existing_systems.dashboard: User dashboard widget showing guild progress

audit_framework.overview: Comprehensive scoring system to evaluate project quality across all dimensions

scoring_scale.B+: 85-89 - Very good with minor improvements needed

criteria: Clean, readable code with proper naming conventions
Appropriate use of design patterns and abstractions
Proper error handling and edge cases covered
Proper use of modern JavaScript/TypeScript features

scoring_guide.A: All criteria met with exceptional code quality
scoring_guide.B: Most criteria met with minor issues
scoring_guide.C: Some criteria met but significant issues present
scoring_guide.D: Many criteria not met, poor code quality
scoring_guide.F: Critical code quality issues, major refactoring needed

criteria: Proper error messages (no sensitive data leaks)

scoring_guide.A: Enterprise-grade security, all best practices followed
scoring_guide.C: Basic security but missing important protections
scoring_guide.F: Critical security flaws, not safe for production

scoring_guide.A: Optimal database design, scalable and efficient
scoring_guide.B: Good design with room for optimization
scoring_guide.C: Functional but inefficient in some areas
scoring_guide.D: Poor design leading to performance issues

scoring_guide.A: Professional API design following all best practices
scoring_guide.D: Poor API design, difficult to use

criteria: Professional polish and attention to detail

scoring_guide.B: Good UX with minor usability issues

criteria: API response times (< 200ms for simple queries)
Tests are meaningful and catch bugs

scoring_guide.B: Good Docker setup with minor issues

criteria: IAM roles and permissions following least privilege

scoring_guide.B: Good setup with minor improvements needed
scoring_guide.C: Basic AWS setup, lacks best practices
scoring_guide.F: No AWS setup or critical issues

criteria: All 7 guilds properly configured with unique themes
Dynamic theme switching working correctly across all pages
Guild membership and role system functional (member, mentor, lead)
Roadmap progress tracking accurate and persistent
Mentor profiles and booking integration working
Resource links valid, organized, and properly categorized
Guild-specific events properly filtered and displayed
Progress persistence across sessions with proper sync
Guild analytics and metrics tracking implemented
Admin interface for guild management complete
Personalization working (joined guilds shown first, progress displayed)
All guild components responsive and accessible
Theme colors meet WCAG AA contrast requirements
API endpoints performant and properly secured

scoring_guide.A: Complete guild system, all features working flawlessly, excellent UX
scoring_guide.B: Good implementation with minor feature gaps or polish issues
scoring_guide.C: Basic guild functionality working, needs enhancement and optimization
scoring_guide.D: Incomplete implementation, major features missing or broken
scoring_guide.F: Guild system not functional or critical bugs present

audit_process.frequency: Regular audits recommended (monthly or after major features)
steps: 2. Score each category using the criteria
deliverables: Audit report with scores for each category
List of critical issues requiring immediate attention

scoring_calculation.example: If Code Quality (15%) = A (95), Security (20%) = A+ (98), etc.
scoring_calculation.interpretation: Final letter grade based on total weighted score
